page.title: 18RECREATION: HORSE RIDING
page.content: {ALLENDALE HORSE RANGERS CENTRE. { }Allendale is a member of the Horse Rangers Association. It is also mentioned on the "Woodland" page. It is owned by Mr.and Mrs.G.P.Allen. Horse Rangers' National Headquarters are at Hampton Court, in Surrey, where there are various events to which people come from all over the country. Behind the stable there is a very old barn in which they serve refreshments and hold functions to raise money for the charity. Outside a balcony overlooks a paddock where they have displays and teach beginners. In the summer they go for picnic rides to Brighstone Forest and the beach. The more experienced Rangers ride in the copse or the moor but keep to the paths so as not to disturb the wildlife. "Mucking out" and general chores keeps the cost of riding down.
